title: Britain gets into the spirit of Halloween as people share their weird and wonderful costumes
text:
Advertisement

With just two days to go until Halloween, Britons have already begun preparing their outfits for a night of spooky antics - with eccentric costumes including children dressed as Boris Johnson and a woman wearing an avocado.

Thousands up and down the country are expected to dress up over the coming days for the annual celebration of all things frightening and ghoulish.

And creative fans have already started trying on their outfits ahead of Thursday, with costumes including dogs dressed in Momo masks and witches - with one even referencing the Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy feud.

While elsewhere, someone has decided to recycle their wedding dress and use it as an outfit this year, saying: 'Thanks to my ex I have one great Halloween costume this year'.

It comes as research by Beano found the Prime Minister is the tenth most topical option for families at Halloween this year, on a list topped by Pennywise the clown from IT 2, with Spider-Man in second place.

The top 20 Halloween outfit choices for 2019 include The Joker, Wonder Woman and characters from Stranger Things and video game Fortnite.

Candice Hobson shared a picture of her son dressed up in his Halloween outfit. While on Twitter, another Halloween fan (right) said: 'thanks to my ex I have one great Halloween costume this year'

One pet owner, from Gloucestershire, has even dressed up her dogs ahead of Halloween. Writing on Twitter, they said: 'practicing for Halloween if we go trick or treating. Momo was once half bird and now half dog'

Future Directions, a social care provider in north west England, shared pictures of residents dressed up in their Halloween garb. Writing on Twitter, they said: 'The team in Trafford got creative in organising a Halloween Party for the people we support. The party took place at Trafford PHAB Club and Lesley won the best fancy dress costume. Some great spooky outfits by all'

Another shared a picture of their pregnant sister who dressed up as an avocado, saying: 'My pregnant sis went to a Halloween party tonight. Asked for a pic of her costume'

In North Shire, Liverton near Middlesbrough a group of people dressed up as witches for the annual 'Brooma witch dance'

Twitter user Kieran Nuge, from Belfast, Norther Ireland, posted his innovative Halloween costume online and people thought it was 'amazing'. His costume is based on the social media feud between Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy

Elsewhere, Grace Latter, went as a disgruntled customer. She said on Twitter: The theme for this Halloween party was "people who belong in hell". Hi, I’m Karen. I’m extremely dissatisfied with this service, and I’d like to speak to your manager'
description: Thousands up and down the UK are expected to dress up over the coming days for the annual celebration of all things frightening and ghoulish. Creative fans have already started.
